titleInfo.title: Alton Gliedman correspondence with Grady M. Long, 1943 December 18

mods.abstract: Letter from Alton Gliedman Jr. to Grady Long in which Gliedman discusses his possession of Leroy Sullivan's diaries. The letter includes a note from Sullivan to give them to Long in the event of Sullivan's death. Gliedman explains his hesitancy to mail them because of the Censorship Regulations but states he will send them to Long upon his return to Atlanta, Georgia. Glideman remebers Sullian as a "a dear friend" and states, "I miss him very much. His ready wit and everpresent smile made the burden lighter." Gliedman encloses as copy of a 1941 September 22 letter from Sullivan to Grady in which Sullivan explains that he is bequething the diaries to Grady in order to spare his mother the knowledge of the hardships of war.
